ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept to value meaning. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.: A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.

A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)

A state of curiosity or concern about or attention to something.
The act of taking part in an activity.

A solid composed of a small, round object composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._A characteristic to be considered; a distinct feature or element._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

Concepts.definition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
A characteristic to be considered; a distinct feature or element.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question._To or at a greater distance in time or space._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
To or at a greater distance in time or space.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the consent withdrawal type?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: A patient is considered to have withdrawn their consent to participate in a clinical trial when the patient no longer wishes to participate in the clinical trial and does not want any future clinical data submitted.  Please confirm the following

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2/13/24 Created CDE and added AQT for ticket number CADSR0003395 for CCTG cjl.
